results.title: 2 A.M. Feeding
results.brief_description: A realistic look at parenting during the first few months after birth. Touches on a wide range of parental concerns such as nursing, crying and colic, fatigue, mother’s recovery, sexuality, fathering, single parenthood, and returning to work. The program is straightforward, presenting a diverse group of new parents who relate their experiences with warmth and humour.

results.title: 2 1/2 = Two-and-a-half
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Brian Pearce
results.brief_description: A revealing study of two two-and-a-half year old children at play indoors on a winter afternoon, without adult surveillance or interference. Records every playful antic, every friction, and every laughing word or sound of protest.

results.title: 1999 Cinemedia Grierson lecture: screen literacy and cultural morality in the digital era
results.brief_description: This is the video recording of Lord Puttnam’s lecture on “Screen literacy and cultural morality in the digital era”. The lecture was held at the Village City Centre, Melbourne, Tuesday 23 November 1999 at 7:00pm, and is part of Cinemedia’s Grierson Lectures. Cinemedia is an Australian cultural organisation which encourages and assists the development, production, exhibition and knowledge of film, television and new media. As part of its mission to promote discussion about screen culture, Cinemedia runs the annual Grierson Lecture. A transcript of the lecture is available as a separate loan item.

results.title: 1993 World solar challenge
results.creator_credit: GMH, Monash University. Mechanical Engineering, Caulfield and Don Scutt
results.brief_description: Covers the 1993 Daido Hoxan World Solar Challenge, a race by solar powered cars from Darwin to Adelaide over 3000 kilometres. Includes interviews with the leading teams and technical experts.

results.title: 1990s Australian TV miniature
results.credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
results.brief_description: This gorgeous miniature TV model celebrates the evolving living rooms of Australians and beloved TV from the 1990s.

constellations_primary.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_primary.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.description: Skippy had stiff competition for the title of Australia’s most beloved (and fictional) marsupial when Blinky Bill debuted in 1993. Based on Dorothy Wall’s books, the animated series incorporated environmental messages into its storylines and saw film and video game spin-offs. The analysis of Australian politics got satirical with Frontline, as local TV began to stretch the possibilities of what it could do creatively. While Home & Away was finding mainstream success, teenage soap Heartbreak High premiered in 1994 and tackled heady subjects for the time including racism, homelessness, drug addiction and sexuality. Crucially, it also introduced the phrase “rack off” into the pop-cultural lexicon.
description_for_label: Skippy had stiff competition for the title of Australia’s most beloved (and fictional) marsupial when Blinky Bill debuted in 1993. Based on Dorothy Wall’s books, the animated series incorporated environmental messages into its storylines and saw film and video game spin-offs. The analysis of Australian politics got satirical with Frontline, as local TV began to stretch the possibilities of what it could do creatively. While Home & Away was finding mainstream success, teenage soap Heartbreak High premiered in 1994 and tackled heady subjects for the time including racism, homelessness, drug addiction and sexuality. Crucially, it also introduced the phrase “rack off” into the pop-cultural lexicon.

results.title: 1989 Redex Variety Club Bash
results.brief_description: Adventurer, Dick Smith, began the Bash in 1985 and since then it has grown to be one of the largest fund-raising events anywhere in the world. It is uniquely Australian. A drive in the Outback with a few mates, which at the same time helps raise money for less fortunate children. The 1989 Bash went from the South East of Australia across three States and the Northern Territory, to the North-West of the Continent, an epic 12 day, 1,600 kilometre drive. All vehicles taking part had to be built before 1966. 208 cars and nearly 1,000 people took part in the Bash and raised over two million dollars for the Variety Club of Australia, and all that money will go towards helping handicapped or underprivileged children throughout Australia.

results.title: 1985 World Hang Gliding Championships
results.brief_description: The fifth World Championship of Hang Gliding staged in the magnificent Alps of Austria. Speed, Distance and Time in air, constitute the judging criteria. Narrated by Peter Wheeler.

results.title: 1984 revisited
results.brief_description: Takes elements of Orwell’s “1984” such as “Big Brother” authoritarianism, information banks, torture and “doublespeak”, and examines how they match some of the events of contemporary history.

results.title: 1984 [a discussion]
results.brief_description: Considers George Orwell’s classic text “1984”. Provides an exposition of Owell’s basic themes together with a consideration of his intention to warn against tendencies he saw in society and an assessment of their realization compared with Huxley’s grim warning in “Brave New World”
